metadata.title: CVE-2015-7872 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The key_gc_unused_keys function in security/keys/gc.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.2.6 allows local users to cause a denial of service (OOPS) viacrafted keyctl commands.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-70-generic - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-lowlatency - 3.13.0-70.113

linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-70-generic - 3.13.0-70.113
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-70.113').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-lts-utopic package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-55.74~14.04.1').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-37.42~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-21.25~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
